AbiRepositoryConfigSchema.description:
The ABI repository is used to decode ABI information from smart contract calls and event logs.
It generates and adds some additional information in transactions and events, including smart contract
method call parameter names, values and data types, as well as smart contract names associated with a
particular contract address.

abiFileExtension.description: Set to `.json` by default as the file extension for ABIs

decodeAnonymous.description:
If enabled, ethlogger will attempt to decode function calls and event logs using a set of
common signatures as a fallback if no match against any supplied ABI definition was found.

directory.description: If specified, the ABI repository will recursively search this directory for ABI files

fingerprintContracts.description:
If enabled, the ABI repsitory will creates hashes of all function and event signatures of an ABI
(the hash is the fingerprint) and match it against the EVM bytecode obtained from live smart contracts
we encounter.

searchRecursive.description: `true` to search ABI directory recursively for ABI files

BlockWatcherConfigSchema.description:
Block watcher is the component that retrieves blocks, transactions, event logs from the node and sends
them to output.

blocksMaxChunkSize.description: Max. number of blocks to fetch at once

enabled.description: Specify `false` to disable the block watcher

maxParallelChunks.description: Max. number of chunks to process in parallel

pollInterval.description: Interval in which to look for the latest block number (if not busy processing the backlog)

retryWaitTime.description: Wait time before retrying to fetch and process blocks after failure

startAt.description: If no checkpoint exists (yet), this specifies which block should be chosen as the starting point.

CheckpointConfigSchema.description:
The checkpoint is where ethlogger keeps track of its state, which blocks have already been processed.
This allows it to resume where it left off after being shut down and restarted.

filename.description: File path (relative to the current working directory) where the checkpoint file will be stored

saveInterval.description: Maximum duration before saving updated checkpoint information to disk

ConsoleOutputConfig.description: Console output prints all generated events and metrics to STDOUT

ContractInfoConfigSchema.description:
Ethlogger checks for each address it encounters whether it is a smart contract by attempting to
retrieve the contract code. To reduce the performance hit by this operation, ethlogger can cache
contract information in memory.

maxCacheEntries.description: Maximum number of contract info results to cache in memory. Set to 0 to disable the cache.

DevNullOutputConfig.description: Null output will just drop all generated events and metrics

EthereumClientConfigSchema.description: Etherem client settings - configure batching multiple JSON RPC method calls into single HTTP requests

maxBatchSize.description: Maximum number of JSON RPC requests to pack into a single batch. Set to `1` to disable batching.

maxBatchTime.description: Maximum time to wait before submitting a batch of JSON RPC requests

EthereumConfigSchema.description: General Ethereum configuration including client and transport, defining how ethlogger talks to the ethereum node

chain.description:
Chain name logged as a field with every event and metric.
Ethlogger will attempt to automatically determine if not specified
but there are only a handful of known public chainIds associated
with particular ethereum-based chains. This value will allow
consumers of data to distinguish between different chains
in case multiple chains are being logged to one place.

network.description:
Network name logged as a field with every event and metric.
Ethlogger will attempt to automatically determine if not specified
but there are only a handful of known public networkIds associated
with particular networks (ethereum mainnet, ropsten, ...). Typical
values of the network name are `"mainnet"` or `"testnet"`.

ExponentalBackoffConfig.description: Exponentiallly increasing wait time with randomness

FileOutputConfig.description: File output will append all generated messages to a file. (this output type has not been implemented)

default.description:
Base settings that apply to all HEC clients. Overrides for events, metrics and
internal metrics will be layered on top of the defaults and allow for using
different HEC tokens, URL or destination index.

events.description: HEC settings (overrides for `default`) for events sent to Splunk

internal.description: HEC settings (overrides for `default`) for internal metrics sent to Splunk

metrics.description: HEC settings (overrides for `default`) for metrics sent to Splunk

HecConfigSchema.description: Settings for the Splunk HTTP Event Collector client

defaultFields.description: Default set of fields to apply to all events and metrics sent with this HEC client

defaultMetadata.description: Defaults for host, source, sourcetype and index. Can be overriden for each message

flushTime.description: Maximum number of milliseconds to wait before flushing the HEC message queue

gzip.description: Gzip compress the request body sent to HEC (Content-Encoding: gzip)

maxQueueEntries.description: Maximum number of entries in the HEC message queue before flushing it

maxQueueSize.description: Maximum number of bytes in the HEC message queue before flushing it

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of attempts to send a batch to HEC. By default this there is no limit

maxSockets.description: Maximum number of sockets HEC will use (per host)

multipleMetricFormatEnabled.description:
Enable sending multipe metrics in a single message to HEC.
Supported as of Splunk 8.0.0

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.0.0/Metrics/GetMetricsInOther#The_multiple-metric_JSON_format

requestKeepAlive.description: Set to `false` to disable HTTP keep-alive for connections to Splunk

retryWaitTime.description: Wait time before retrying to send a (batch of) HEC messages after an error

timeout.description: Number of milliseconds to wait before considereing an HTTP request as failed

token.description: The HEC token used to authenticate HTTP requests

url.description: The URL of HEC. If only the base URL is specified (path is omitted) then the default path will be used

validateCertificate.description: If set to false, the HTTP client will ignore certificate errors (eg. when using self-signed certs)

waitForAvailability.description:
If set to > 0, then ethlogger will wait for the HEC service to become available for the given amount of time
by periodically attempting to request the collector/health REST endpoint. This can be useful when starting
Splunk and ethlogger for example in docker-compose, where Splunk takes some time to start.

metricsPrefix.description: A common prefix for all metrics emitted to Splunk

sourcetypes.description: Sourcetypes to use for different kinds of events we send to Splunk

HttpTransportConfigSchema.description: Settings for ethlogger connecting to the ethereum node via JSON RPC over HTTP

maxSockets.description: Maximum number of sockets HEC will use (per host)

requestKeepAlive.description: Keep sockets to JSON RPC open

timeout.description: Time before failing JSON RPC requests. Specify a number in milliseconds or a golang-style duration expression.

validateCertificate.description: If set to false, the HTTP client will ignore certificate errors (eg. when using self-signed certs)

InternalMetricsConfigSchema.description: Ethlogger-internal metrics allow for visibility into the operation of ethlogger itself.

collectInterval.description: Interval in which to collect internal metrics

enabled.description: Specify `false` to disable internal metrics collection

min.description: Minimum wait time (after the first failure)

step.description: Increase of wait time for each failure after the first until max is reached

NodeInfoConfigSchema.description: Platform specific node information is collection on regular interval

collectInterval.description: Interval in which to collect node info

enabled.description: Specify `false` to disable node info collection

retryWaitTime.description: Wait time before retrying to collect node info after failure

collectInterval.description: Interval in which to collect pending transactions

enabled.description: Enable or disable collection of pending transactions

retryWaitTime.description: Wait time before retrying to collect pending transactions after failure

SourcetypesSchema.description: Configurable set of `sourcetype` field values emitted by ethlogger

blockWatcher.description: Block watcher settings, configure how blocks, transactions, event logs are ingested

checkpoint.description: Checkpoint configuration - how ethlogger keeps track of state between restarts

nodeInfo.description: Settings for the node info collector

nodeMetrics.description: Settings for the node metrics collector

output.description:
In the output configuration you can specify where ethlogger will send generated
metrics and events to. By default it will send all information to Splunk HEC,
but you can instead send it to console output or a file.

pendingTx.description: Settings for collecting pending transactions from node
